public class Controller extends Object
Class that represents the Controller

    Constructor of the Class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addGui(view.GUI.GUIView gui)
    Method used to add a GUIView.
    void
    calculateScore()
    Method that calculates the total score of a player.
    void
    checkBoardToBeFilled()
    Method that, if the Board needs to be filled, gets the needed tiles from the Bag after eventually emptying the Board.
    util.Event
    checkIfGameEnd()
    Method that checks the status of match.
    This method returns a specific Event based on the match status:
    - if the game is ended it returns an Event.GAME_OVER;
    - if it's the last turn it returns an Event.LAST_TURN;
    - if the game isn't in any of the two previous conditions it returns an Event.OK.
    util.Event
    chooseColumn(int chosenColumn)
    Method that given an int permits the player to choose the column in which it wants to put its tiles.
    This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
    - if chosenColumn<0 || chosenColumn >4 it returns an Event.INVALID_VALUE;
    - if the player tries to put its tiles in a column that doesn't have enough slots it returns an Event.OUT_OF_BOUNDS;
    - if the player made a correct choice it returns an Event.OK.
    util.Event
    chooseNickname(@NotNull String nickname)
    Method that given a String as a parameter creates a new Player and sets its nickname.
    This also adds the player inside a list of players that represents the players in a match.
    If the client chose its nickname correctly this method will return an Event.OK; otherwise, if a client inserted an empty string this will return an Event.EMPTY_NICKNAME, if a client inserted a nickname that has already been chosen this will return an Event.NOT_AVAILABLE.
    util.Event
    chooseTiles(@NotNull ArrayList<util.Cord> cords)
    Method that given a list of coordinates picks up tiles from the board (only if the player chose correct tiles).
    This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
    - if the player tries to pick up a tile that is not on the board it returns an Event.OUT_OF_BOUNDS;
    - if the player tries to pick up the same tile it returns an Event.REPETITION;
    - if the player tries to pick up a NOTHING or BLOCKED tile it returns an Event.BLOCKED_NOTHING;
    - if the player tries to pick up tiles that are not on the border it returns an Event.NOT_ON_BORDER;
    - if the player tries to pick up tiles that are not adjacent it returns an Event.NOT_ADJACENT;
    - if the player picks up correct tiles it returns an Event.OK.
    util.Event
    chooseTilesDisposition(int index)
    Method that given an int lets the player chose the disposition of the tiles as it puts them into the bookshelf.
    This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
    - if the int is less that zero or is more that the size of the tiles in hand of the player it returns an Event.INVALID_VALUE;
    - if the player chooses a correct int it returns an Event.OK
    util.Event
    chooseUserInterface(int chosenInterface)
    Method used to choose the type of user interface.
    Based on the int in input the client can choose the type of interface that it wants: 1 for a Textual User Interface, 2 for a Graphical User Interface.

      public void createGame()

      Method that instantiates the Game.

    • getBag

      Method that returns the instance of Bag.

      an instance of Bag

    • getInstanceOfGame

      public model.Game getInstanceOfGame()

      Method that returns the current instance of Game.

      Returns:
      the instance of Game relative of a specific match

    • getBoard

      public model.Board getBoard()
      Method that returns the instance of Board.
      Returns:
      an instance of Board

    • chooseNickname

      public util.Event chooseNickname(@NotNull @NotNull String nickname)
      Method that given a String as a parameter creates a new Player and sets its nickname.
      This also adds the player inside a list of players that represents the players in a match.
      If the client chose its nickname correctly this method will return an Event.OK; otherwise, if a client inserted an empty string this will return an Event.EMPTY_NICKNAME, if a client inserted a nickname that has already been chosen this will return an Event.NOT_AVAILABLE.
      Parameters:
      nickname - a String that represents the nickname given in input by the player
      Returns:
      an Event, the type of event depends on the input

    • chooseUserInterface

      public util.Event chooseUserInterface(int chosenInterface)
      Method used to choose the type of user interface.
      Based on the int in input the client can choose the type of interface that it wants: 1 for a Textual User Interface, 2 for a Graphical User Interface.
      This method returns an Event.TUI_VIEW if the client chose a Textual User Interface, an Event.GUI_VIEW, otherwise if the input si not valid this method returns an Event.INVALID_VALUE.
      Parameters:
      chosenInterface - an int in between 1 and 2
      Returns:
      an Event, based on the input

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      Method that initializes the Game for a match.
      This method instantiates the Bag and theBoard, it also assigns an empty Bookshelf, a PersonalGoalCard,to every player in the match.
      Also, it sets the CommonGoalCards, the number of cells based on the number of players in the match, it fills the Board.
      Finally, it sets a player as the first player, sets the firs player as player in turn and starts the game.

      NOTE: This method gets called after all the clients needed to start the game are connected.

    • checkBoardToBeFilled

      public void checkBoardToBeFilled()
      Method that, if the Board needs to be filled, gets the needed tiles from the Bag after eventually emptying the Board.
      If the Bag contains enough tiles the Board gets entirely filled, otherwise the Bag gets emptied and the Board gets partially filled.

    • chooseTiles

      public util.Event chooseTiles(@NotNull @NotNull ArrayList<util.Cord> cords)
      Method that given a list of coordinates picks up tiles from the board (only if the player chose correct tiles).
      This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
      - if the player tries to pick up a tile that is not on the board it returns an Event.OUT_OF_BOUNDS;
      - if the player tries to pick up the same tile it returns an Event.REPETITION;
      - if the player tries to pick up a NOTHING or BLOCKED tile it returns an Event.BLOCKED_NOTHING;
      - if the player tries to pick up tiles that are not on the border it returns an Event.NOT_ON_BORDER;
      - if the player tries to pick up tiles that are not adjacent it returns an Event.NOT_ADJACENT;
      - if the player picks up correct tiles it returns an Event.OK.
      Parameters:
      cords - is an ArrayList of Cord that represents a list of coordinates of the chosen tiles
      Returns:
      an Event based on the input

    • chooseColumn

      public util.Event chooseColumn(int chosenColumn)
      Method that given an int permits the player to choose the column in which it wants to put its tiles.
      This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
      - if chosenColumn<0 || chosenColumn >4 it returns an Event.INVALID_VALUE;
      - if the player tries to put its tiles in a column that doesn't have enough slots it returns an Event.OUT_OF_BOUNDS;
      - if the player made a correct choice it returns an Event.OK.
      Parameters:
      chosenColumn - an int in between 0 and 4 that represents the number of a column
      Returns:
      an Event based on the input

    • chooseTilesDisposition

      public util.Event chooseTilesDisposition(int index)

      Method that given an int lets the player chose the disposition of the tiles as it puts them into the bookshelf.
      This method returns a specific Event based on the input:
      - if the int is less that zero or is more that the size of the tiles in hand of the player it returns an Event.INVALID_VALUE;
      - if the player chooses a correct int it returns an Event.OK

      Parameters:
      index - an int that represents the index of one of the tiles from the tiles in hand
      Returns:
      an Event based on the input

    • calculateScore

      public void calculateScore()
      Method that calculates the total score of a player.

    • checkIfGameEnd

      public util.Event checkIfGameEnd()

      Method that checks the status of match.
      This method returns a specific Event based on the match status:
      - if the game is ended it returns an Event.GAME_OVER;
      - if it's the last turn it returns an Event.LAST_TURN;
      - if the game isn't in any of the two previous conditions it returns an Event.OK.

      Returns:
      an Event based on the match status

      Parameters:
      playerInTurn - a player that has to be set as the player in turn

    • updateController

      public util.Event updateController(Object obj, @NotNull @NotNull util.Event event)
      Method that updates the controller based on the two received parameters.
      Parameters:
      obj - is the object that has to be set as an update
      event - is a specific Event needed to do a specific update
      Returns:
      a specific type of error, for brevity the list of possible errors won't be described

    • getControllerModel

      public Object getControllerModel(@NotNull @NotNull util.Event event, Object playerIndex)

      Method that given two parameters returns a specific object.
      This method is used to make the player make choices during the match.

      Parameters:
      event - is a specific Event needed to get a specific object
      playerIndex - is an object used to perform specific actions
      Returns:
      an Object used to let the player chose some actions during the match
